alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; Southern Salinas Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued June 30 at 2:38AM PDT until July 02 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 AM PDT SATURDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 8 PM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Excessive Heat Warning, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures between 100 and 111 degrees expected. For the Heat Advisory, daytime temperatures between the upper 90s and 106 degrees expected. * WHERE...Southern Salinas Valley and San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys. * WHEN...For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 10 AM Saturday to 8 PM PDT Sunday. For the Heat Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 10 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight low temperatures in some locations will offer little reprieve from the heat with temperatures only cooling to around 70 degrees.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; Southern Salinas Valley
